page.title: 03CLEETHORPES MAN IN ALASKA
page.content: Cleethorpes adventurer,Alan Cheshire, aged 25,in the spring of 1985 took part in the{Iditarod Trail Race,}known as "The Last Great Race On Earth".The race was from the city of{Anchorage in {Southern Alaska,}over 1049 miles of mountain ranges, frozen rivers, dense forests and desolate tundra to Nome. It attracted "mushers" and their dog-sled teams from all over the world. During the race Alan was twice held up because of{bad weather,}lost two of his dogs and experienced temperatures of -50 degrees and headwinds of 70mph. Suffering from {snow-blindness}and{frostbite}he finished 32nd of 72 starters and 40 finishers and was awarded a trophy for being 'sportsman of the Race'.Several local charities will benefit from sponsorship of the race.
